intro: Convolvulus quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its helix-like, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves with five distinct veins. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Convolvulus quinquenervis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
